Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 2 wickets (with 4 balls remaining)
Asitha Fernando hit two fours in the last four balls of the match
Asitha Fernando hit the ball into long-on for the two that sealed the deal
Kusal Mendis survived four lives while scoring a 37-ball 60
Bangladesh's opening pair scored at a 140-plus strike rate in an innings spanning more than 25 balls for only the third time this year
Pre-Game Insights: Mehidy Hasan Miraz, playing his first T20I in four years, rocked Sri Lanka with a brisk start
Bangladesh sent out Sabbir Rahman and Mehidy Hasan Miraz after exhausting six different opening pairs this year
Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh were left ruing a dropped catch, a wicket chalked off when Mahedi bowled a no-ball, a missed run-out, and a review not taken

Sri Lanka kept on picking up wickets, with Chamika Karunaratne getting one to rear into his face, and his attempted glide towards third-man took the shoulder of the bat and only went as far as wicketkeeper Mendis
Ebadot Hossain salvaged Bangladesh's powerplay, removing Pathum Nissanka and Charith Asalanka in his first over in T20Is
Mendis rides his luck, surviving four lives in his 37-ball stay
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mahedi Hasan removed Dasun Shanaka in the 18th over after the Sri Lanka captain struck a 33-ball 45 with three fours and two sixes
Chamika Karunaratne was run out by a Shakib Al Hasan direct hit
Mehidy Hasan Miraz hit two sixes off Karunaratne in the 10th over
Shakib tried to keep the run-rate going at the other end, hitting three fours off Karunaratne in the 10th over
Maheesh Theekshana removed Shakib in the 11th over
Taskin Ahmed hit two fours immediately after walking in, before adding two more fours in a 17-run last over bowled by Asitha
Mendis swung at an Ebadot delivery that took a bit of glove. Neither the bowler nor wicketkeeper Mushfiqur were sure of it, and Bangladesh missed out on sending it up for review
